{"id":1082641306,"question_id":42,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"7 months, 3 weeks","timestamp":1698116447,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"1 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1082641306/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Trapping Rain Water","memory":"43.9 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int trap(int[] height) {\n        int len = height.length;\n        \n        int[] left = new int[len];\n        int[] right = new int[len];\n\n        left[0] = height[0];\n        for(int i=1; i<len; i++){\n            left[i] = Math.max(left[i-1], height[i]);\n        }\n\n        right[len-1] = height[len-1];\n        for(int i=len-2; i>=0; i--){\n            right[i] = Math.max(right[i+1], height[i]);\n        }\n\n\n        int res = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<len; i++){\n            res += Math.min(left[i], right[i])-height[i];\n        }\n\n        return res;\n\n\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"trapping-rain-water","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
